p: To identify the role of MoSec61β in cell wall integrity, we monitored the effects of various cell wall perturbing agents on the Δ Mosec61β mutant. Mycelial growth was measured on MM plates supplemented with CFW, Congo red (CR) and SDS (sodium dodecyl sulfate), compounds known to cause cell wall stress. As shown in Figure 1(g), the sensitivity of the Δ Mosec61β mutant to CFW and Congo red was significantly different from that of both the wild-type Guy11 and the complementation strain Mosec61βc. The growth inhibition rates of Δ Mosec61β to CFW and Congo red were significantly different from those of Guy11 and Mosec61βc (Fig. S2). These results indicated that the loss of MoSec61β affects cell wall integrity.
